intro: Lesquerella purpurea var. foliosa, commonly known as the purple lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its showy purple flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. The species is of interest for its potential in biofuel and industrial applications due to its high oil content.
